definition: Ability to break an ambiguous problem into clear components and a logical workplan.
not_definition: Not subject-matter expertise by itself or simply following a memorized framework.

definition: Ability to form testable hypotheses and use evidence to confirm, reject, or refine them.
not_definition: Not guessing without testing or forcing data to fit a preferred conclusion.
rubric_anchor_0: No hypotheses; reacts to data only

definition: Ability to combine multiple inputs into a coherent, decision-ready takeaway.
not_definition: Not listing facts without prioritizing what matters for the decision.

definition: Ability to identify the meaning behind data and translate patterns into actionable implications.
not_definition: Not reporting metrics without explaining 'so what' or 'now what'.

definition: Ability to convey ideas clearly, concisely, and appropriately to the audience.
not_definition: Not verbosity, charisma alone, or being agreeable without clarity.

definition: Ability to structure information into a compelling narrative that supports a recommendation.
not_definition: Not entertainment or style without logical substance.

definition: Ability to present work confidently and respond to questions with composure and clarity.
not_definition: Not slide aesthetics or memorized talking points without understanding.

definition: Ability to understand stakeholder incentives and align them toward a shared outcome.
not_definition: Not authority, manipulation, or political maneuvering without ethics.

definition: Ability to run discussions that produce decisions, next steps, and shared understanding.
not_definition: Not dominating the room or simply taking notes.
rubric_anchor_5: Keeps meetings on track and productive
rubric_anchor_10: Sets team operating rhythm and norms

definition: Ability to gather and validate information from credible sources and synthesize it for use.
not_definition: Not copying sources uncritically or relying on low-quality information.

definition: Ability to identify root causes of a problem and separate symptoms from drivers.
not_definition: Not treating surface issues only or overfitting to one anecdote.
rubric_anchor_0: Jumps to fixes without root cause
rubric_anchor_5: Finds likely root causes in common cases

definition: Ability to translate questions into numbers, estimates, and metrics that inform decisions.
not_definition: Not precision theater, or complex math without relevance.

definition: Ability to choose what to do first based on impact, effort, and constraints.
not_definition: Not doing whatever is most urgent or most visible.
rubric_anchor_10: Shapes roadmaps; sets priorities for teams

definition: Ability to create shared understanding on goals, roles, and decisions across people.
not_definition: Not avoiding disagreement or forcing consensus prematurely.
rubric_anchor_5: Clarifies goals and decisions in teams

definition: Consistency in checking assumptions, logic, and calculations to reduce errors.
not_definition: Not perfectionism that blocks progress or unnecessary complexity.
rubric_anchor_10: Sets quality bar; audits others' work

definition: Ability to adjust approach quickly when requirements, constraints, or feedback change.
not_definition: Not changing direction randomly or lacking a plan.
rubric_anchor_5: Adjusts with feedback in typical cases

definition: Ability to understand and apply core accounting concepts to produce and interpret financial statements.
not_definition: Not tax specialization or finance strategy without accounting grounding.

definition: Ability to estimate the value of a business or asset using appropriate methods and assumptions.
not_definition: Not predicting stock prices or using one multiple without context.
rubric_anchor_5: Builds a basic valuation with sound inputs

definition: Ability to build structured financial models that link assumptions to outputs and support decisions.
not_definition: Not pretty spreadsheets without correct logic and auditability.

definition: Ability to predict future performance using data, drivers, and reasonable assumptions.
not_definition: Not guessing or extrapolating without understanding drivers.

definition: Ability to use spreadsheets efficiently for analysis, modeling, and reporting.
not_definition: Not manual, error-prone work or relying on templates without understanding.
rubric_anchor_5: Uses pivots, lookups, and clean structure
rubric_anchor_10: Expert automation; audits and optimizes models

definition: Ability to plan and manage budgets, including variance analysis and resource allocation.
not_definition: Not long-term valuation work or unrelated project planning.

definition: Ability to create clear financial reporting that is accurate, timely, and decision-ready.
not_definition: Not data dumping or storytelling without numbers.

definition: Ability to verify financial information and controls through structured testing and evidence.
not_definition: Not policing people or assuming fraud without evidence.

definition: Ability to understand and operate within financial regulations and internal policies.
not_definition: Not legal advice or box-ticking without understanding risk.

definition: Ability to identify, measure, and communicate financial risks and tradeoffs.
not_definition: Not being risk-averse or avoiding decisions.

definition: Ability to use instruments or strategies to reduce exposure to specific financial risks.
not_definition: Not speculation or taking risk without defined purpose.

definition: Ability to assess cash availability, funding needs, and the ease of converting assets to cash.
not_definition: Not profitability analysis alone.
rubric_anchor_5: Understands working capital and cash cycles

definition: Ability to determine appropriate prices for products, services, or financial instruments using drivers and constraints.
not_definition: Not discounting randomly or pricing without margin/risk awareness.
rubric_anchor_5: Prices using basic drivers and benchmarks
rubric_anchor_8: Optimizes price with sensitivity and constraints

definition: Ability to manage cash, funding, and financial operations such as payments and bank relationships.
not_definition: Not investment strategy or accounting close work alone.
rubric_anchor_10: Leads treasury operations and risk controls

definition: Ability to understand tax concepts and apply them correctly in analysis or reporting contexts.
not_definition: Not providing formal tax advice or handling complex cross-border structuring.
rubric_anchor_5: Applies common tax rules in models
rubric_anchor_10: Expert tax planning; ensures compliance at scale

definition: Ability to match records across systems and resolve discrepancies to ensure data integrity.
not_definition: Not ignoring differences or forcing balances without explanation.

definition: Ability to write correct, readable code to solve problems and deliver features.
not_definition: Not knowing syntax only, or coding without testing and maintainability.

definition: Ability to use Python effectively for scripting, data work, or backend development.
not_definition: Not general programming ability without Python-specific competence.
rubric_anchor_5: Writes clean Python for common tasks

definition: Ability to query and manipulate relational data accurately and efficiently.
not_definition: Not spreadsheets-as-databases or guessing results without understanding joins.
rubric_anchor_10: Expert; designs data layers and standards

definition: Ability to use version control to collaborate safely and manage code changes.
not_definition: Not copying commands without understanding or avoiding collaboration workflows.
rubric_anchor_5: Uses branches, PRs, and resolves merges

definition: Ability to design systems with appropriate components, interfaces, and tradeoffs.
not_definition: Not overengineering or drawing diagrams without understanding constraints.

definition: Ability to find, isolate, and fix defects using logs, tests, and systematic reasoning.
not_definition: Not random trial-and-error or blaming dependencies without proof.
rubric_anchor_5: Finds root cause in typical issues
rubric_anchor_10: Improves observability; prevents classes of bugs

definition: Ability to write and maintain tests that protect correctness and enable safe change.
not_definition: Not writing tests that assert nothing meaningful or only manual testing.
rubric_anchor_10: Sets testing culture; designs test architecture

definition: Ability to deliver software to production environments safely and repeatably.
not_definition: Not 'it works on my machine' or manual, risky releases.

definition: Ability to design and improve systems to handle increased load without failure.
not_definition: Not premature optimization or scaling only by adding servers blindly.

definition: Ability to build and operate software with secure defaults and threat awareness.
not_definition: Not fear-driven restrictions or security theater without risk modeling.

definition: Ability to use cloud services to deploy, scale, and operate applications.
not_definition: Not clicking in consoles without understanding IAM, networking, and costs.

definition: Ability to remove manual work through scripts, pipelines, and tooling.
not_definition: Not over-automating unstable processes.

definition: Ability to improve performance, cost, or efficiency through measurement and targeted changes.
not_definition: Not micro-optimizing without measuring impact.
rubric_anchor_10: Sets performance KPIs and tuning playbooks

definition: Ability to write clear docs that help others understand, use, and maintain systems.
not_definition: Not excessive documentation that is outdated or redundant.
rubric_anchor_5: Docs cover setup and key flows
rubric_anchor_8: Docs are concise, current, and adopted

definition: Ability to connect systems via APIs, data contracts, and reliable interfaces.
not_definition: Not brittle point-to-point hacks without monitoring or contracts.

definition: Ability to build and operate systems that behave predictably and recover from failure.
not_definition: Not avoiding change or moving slowly without reason.
rubric_anchor_10: Sets SRE practices; drives reliability culture

definition: Ability to build and manage a coherent brand identity and perception over time.
not_definition: Not logo design alone or generic 'aesthetic taste' without strategy.
rubric_anchor_8: Builds brand equity; adapts across channels
rubric_anchor_10: Leads brand strategy; shapes market perception

definition: Ability to craft value propositions and messages that resonate with target audiences.
not_definition: Not jargon-heavy copy or saying everything to everyone.
rubric_anchor_5: Clear value prop for a defined audience

definition: Ability to write persuasive, brand-consistent copy that drives action.
not_definition: Not long text, filler, or clickbait that damages trust.
rubric_anchor_5: Writes clear copy for common formats

definition: Ability to plan and execute campaigns with objectives, channels, and measurement.
not_definition: Not posting randomly without a goal or measurement.

definition: Ability to divide audiences into meaningful groups for tailored marketing strategy.
not_definition: Not demographic stereotypes without behavioral or needs-based insight.
rubric_anchor_8: Validates segments with data and outcomes

definition: Ability to define how a product should be perceived relative to alternatives.
not_definition: Not copying competitors or changing positioning every week.
rubric_anchor_5: Clear positioning statement and proof points
rubric_anchor_8: Positioning ties to strategy and GTM

definition: Ability to choose the right segments and channels to reach business goals efficiently.
not_definition: Not maximizing reach regardless of cost or relevance.
rubric_anchor_5: Targets main segments and channels well

definition: Ability to create content and experiences that drive meaningful audience interaction.
not_definition: Not vanity metrics without quality or retention.
rubric_anchor_8: Designs engagement loops and content systems

definition: Ability to bring in new users/customers through channels with measured ROI.
not_definition: Not spending on ads without attribution or targeting.
rubric_anchor_5: Runs acquisition channels with basic tracking

definition: Ability to improve repeat usage and reduce churn through lifecycle strategy.
not_definition: Not discounting only or forcing lock-in without value.
rubric_anchor_5: Tracks retention and runs basic initiatives

definition: Ability to improve funnel performance through UX, messaging, and testing.
not_definition: Not manipulating users or optimizing one step while harming downstream quality.
rubric_anchor_5: Improves key steps with basic tests
rubric_anchor_10: Leads CRO program; sets experimentation cadence

definition: Ability to generate novel, relevant ideas for content, campaigns, and positioning.
not_definition: Not randomness or novelty that conflicts with brand and strategy.

definition: Ability to improve organic search visibility through technical, content, and on-page work.
not_definition: Not keyword stuffing or chasing rankings without intent.

definition: Ability to build and nurture a group of users with shared identity and engagement.
not_definition: Not broadcasting content without two-way interaction.

definition: Ability to source, structure, and manage partnerships that create mutual value.
not_definition: Not one-off deals that harm brand or lack clear outcomes.

definition: Ability to run structured experiments with hypotheses, metrics, and learnings.
not_definition: Not random changes without a test plan or measurement.
rubric_anchor_5: Runs A/B tests with basic analysis

definition: Ability to design engineered solutions that meet requirements, constraints, and safety considerations.
not_definition: Not aesthetics-only design or ideation without feasibility.
rubric_anchor_5: Creates workable designs with basic constraints
rubric_anchor_8: Optimizes designs; considers tradeoffs and manufacturability

definition: Ability to create accurate CAD models and drawings suitable for review and manufacture.
not_definition: Not rough sketches or models without correct dimensions and constraints.
rubric_anchor_10: Expert; builds CAD standards and libraries

definition: Ability to build and iterate prototypes to test assumptions and reduce design risk.
not_definition: Not one-off builds without learning goals.
rubric_anchor_5: Builds prototypes to test key functions
rubric_anchor_8: Rapid iteration; learns and improves design

definition: Ability to understand production processes, constraints, and how designs translate to manufacturing.
not_definition: Not product design without considering process capability and yield.

definition: Ability to select and justify materials based on properties, cost, and constraints.
not_definition: Not brand preferences or guessing without data.
rubric_anchor_5: Selects materials for common use cases

definition: Ability to apply mechanics principles to analyze loads, motion, and structural behavior.
not_definition: Not memorizing formulas without understanding assumptions.
rubric_anchor_8: Handles complex systems; validates with reality

definition: Ability to design or analyze circuits and basic electronic systems safely and correctly.
not_definition: Not plugging modules together without understanding signals and power.
rubric_anchor_5: Builds basic circuits; debugs with tools

definition: Ability to apply thermodynamics to analyze energy transfer and system efficiency.
not_definition: Not just knowing definitions without solving real problems.

definition: Ability to simulate systems (e.g., FEA/CFD) to predict behavior and inform design decisions.
not_definition: Not running software without understanding boundary conditions or interpreting results.
rubric_anchor_5: Runs basic simulations and interprets output
rubric_anchor_10: Expert; builds simulation workflows and standards

definition: Ability to use MATLAB/Simulink for numerical analysis, modeling, and prototyping algorithms.
not_definition: Not general math ability without MATLAB competence.
rubric_anchor_5: Writes scripts for common analysis tasks
rubric_anchor_10: Expert; builds reusable tooling and models

definition: Ability to specify and interpret tolerances to ensure assemblies function and can be manufactured.
not_definition: Not over-tight tolerances that increase cost without benefit.
rubric_anchor_8: Optimizes tolerances for cost and function
rubric_anchor_10: Expert; sets drawing and GD&T standards

definition: Ability to plan and execute tests that confirm designs meet requirements and standards.
not_definition: Not ad-hoc testing without traceability to requirements.
rubric_anchor_5: Executes tests with clear pass/fail criteria

definition: Ability to identify hazards and design processes and products to reduce risk and meet safety standards.
not_definition: Not risk avoidance without analysis or ignoring standards.

definition: Ability to maintain quality through standards, inspections, and continuous improvement.
not_definition: Not bureaucracy or rejecting work without constructive fixes.

definition: Ability to maintain and troubleshoot equipment/systems to restore function and prevent failures.
not_definition: Not only reactive repairs without preventive strategy.

definition: Ability to improve output or performance relative to time, cost, energy, or materials.
not_definition: Not cutting corners that reduce safety or quality.
rubric_anchor_10: Builds systems for ongoing efficiency gains

definition: Consistent, respectful, workplace-appropriate behavior and communication.
not_definition: Not “confidence” or “extroversion.”

definition: Takes responsibility for outcomes and follows through without being chased.
not_definition: Not “controlling” or “doing everything alone.”

definition: Starts useful work, asks smart questions, and proposes next steps unprompted.
not_definition: Not “impulsiveness” or “overstepping.”

definition: Owns mistakes, communicates status honestly, and closes loops.
not_definition: Not “perfection” or “never failing.”

definition: Delivers what was agreed, when it was agreed, at expected quality.
not_definition: Not “speed at all costs.”

definition: Arrives on time and meets deadlines with predictable timing.
not_definition: Not “working long hours.”

definition: Accepts feedback well and applies it quickly and visibly.
not_definition: Not “agreeing with everything.”

definition: Genuine drive to understand “why/how” and explore beyond the obvious.
not_definition: Not “random distraction.”

definition: Speed and effectiveness in acquiring new skills and applying them.
not_definition: Not “years of experience.”

definition: Maintains performance through setbacks, stress, and ambiguity.
not_definition: Not “ignoring burnout.”

definition: Stays calm, clear, and constructive in high-pressure situations.
not_definition: Not “emotionless.”

definition: Sustains productive routines and avoids procrastination reliably.
not_definition: Not “micromanagement.”

definition: Keeps tasks, files, notes, and commitments structured and easy to track.
not_definition: Not “neat desk aesthetics.”

definition: Plans work into realistic time blocks and manages focus/interruptions.
not_definition: Not “working faster” only.

definition: Works effectively with others: shares context, supports, and co-delivers.
not_definition: Not “being agreeable always.”

definition: Understands others’ perspectives and adapts communication accordingly.
not_definition: Not “people-pleasing.”

definition: Handles disagreement and sensitive topics with tact and alignment.
not_definition: Not “avoiding conflict.”

definition: Acts honestly and ethically, even when inconvenient.
not_definition: Not “rule-following blindly.”

definition: Makes sound decisions with limited info; knows when to escalate.
not_definition: Not “IQ” or “seniority.”

definition: Works independently, unblocks self, and seeks help at the right time.
not_definition: Not “working alone” or “ignoring feedback.”

definition: Finds solutions with limited resources; uses tools/people creatively.
not_definition: Not “cutting corners.”

definition: Pays attention to instructions, context, and details that matter.
not_definition: Not “perfectionism.”

definition: Communicates ideas in a clear, structured, low-ambiguity way.
not_definition: Not “being talkative.”

definition: Practical ability to work during the needed period (dates/hours).
not_definition: Not “motivation” or “work ethic.”
